The aims of the present thesis is twofold: on the one hand, it aims to investigate and examine how readers react to difficult literary texts; on the other, it intends to support and emphasise the importance of empirical approaches to the field of literature, presenting a multidisciplinary approach which brings together perspectives from psychology, linguistics and literary criticism.
